title: Scout can submit a player profile/ submitted items open in view mode
custom_steps:
Login as a domestic scout
In the create New widget, Enter First name, last name, DOB and School
Click Next
Fill in required fields on profile
Click Submit
custom_expected:
Blue notification on the bottom right appears and successfully submits
Player appears in the Scouts Clipboard as "Submitted" Status
Player appears in Admin's clipboard as "Submitted Status
When re-opening the item from the scout clipboard, it will open in view mode

title: Scout can save a player profile, preliminary will always open in edit mode
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Fill in all fields on the create new widget for a new amateur player
Click Next
Fill in eligible year and any other field, click SAVE

Go back to home dashboard
View the scout clipboard, and locate the player you saved above
Click on "Player Entered" Link from the clipboard
custom_expected:
Player profile opens in edit mode since it is preliminary
player profile has a status of preliminary
profile has save, submit and close buttons

title: Scout cannot make any changes to a submitted profile
custom_steps:
Login as a domestic scout
View the clipboard, and click on a profile who has a status of submitted
custom_expected:
Player profile should open in read mode
The only button on this page should be CLOSE as scout can NOT make edits here

title: Admin submitted preliminary players appear on admin clipboards
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
Fill in fields on the create new widget and click Next
Fill in any fields on the profile and click Save
custom_expected:
Blue success notification appears in bottom right
Player profile has a status of preliminary
Player appears on the admins clipboard with a status of preliminary

title: scout can delete preliminary player
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Go to Scouting clipboard
3) Find player with a status of “Preliminary” 
4) Click the checkbox to the left of the players name
5) Click delete button
6) A message will pop up to verify deletion - Click “Yes”
custom_expected: The preliminary player will be successfully deleted and removed from the system entirely

title: scout cannot delete submitted player
custom_steps:
Login as a domestic scout
View the clipboard and find any item with a status of "submitted"
Check the checkbox to the left of the item and click Delete button
custom_expected: User will get an error message stating that the item has been submitted and cannot be deleted

title: Scout can make updates to an approved player profile
custom_steps:
Login as a domestic scout
In Quicksearch, enter a last name to find a player ( i.e. Jackson)
Click on any players name from the quicksearch results to open the profile
Ensure the player status is *Approved* (in the header)
Click Edit
Make any changes you would like and click "Submit" button
custom_expected:
Blue notification of success appears
Changes you made to the fields are applied.
The player update you submitted will also appear in the admins clipboard under "Player Updated"

title: Admin can view player updates
custom_steps:
Login as a MLSB admin
View the clipboard, and filter to "Player Updates"
Find the player you updated in previous test case
Click on the "Player Updated" link (No other link from the clipboard will open the correct update but this one)
custom_expected:
Admin can view the profile changes in red (Only the fields you edited will be in red, all else should be in black text)
Admin has the approve/reject, edit/save and cancel buttons available

title: Admin can make edits to a player update and approve
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Enter any 4 letters in quicksearch to find a player profile ( i.e. Jack to find players with last name Jackson)
Click on a profile to open it
Ensure that the status of the profile is approved
Click Edit
Make changes to any fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
Filter the admin clipboard by "Player Updated"
Locate the player you just updated in pre steps
Click on "Player Updated' link from the clipboard
Make any edits to any fields
Click Approve
custom_expected:
Changes made by scout and admin are saved
Profile now has a status of approved with new changes

title: Admin can reject a player update
custom_preconds:
Login as scout admin
Filter the clipboard to show "Player Updates"
Select the 'Player Updated" link to open the update
custom_steps: Scroll to the bottom of the update and click Reject button
custom_expected:
The status of the Player Update should now be rejected.

Note: Submitting scout can still see rejected updates in red. Any other user sees original profile with no updates.
If an admin opens the update, they can view the rejected info in red. If admin opens the player profile from QuickSearch or Advanced Search, the original profile without updates should display.

title: Scout can edit contact information in player profile
custom_steps:
Login as domestic scout
Select a player profile from clipboard that is still preliminary status
At the bottom of profile, select edit
In edit mode make changes to phone number and email (Edit current ones, add new ones, delete current ones).
Save changes
custom_expected:
Scout should successfully be able to edit, add and delete emails and phone numbers.
Note: can only delete phone number or email if there is more than one entry because there must be at least one phone number and one email.

title: System shows matching message for existing player
custom_preconds:
Login as domestic scout
From the Film List Tracking widget, find any player and note his information down
custom_steps:
Locate the create new widget
Enter a soft match for the player noted above (same first name, last name, date of birth, DIFFERENT SCHOOL)
CLick Next
*Matching message should pop up showing a 70% match with the buttons to "Add Report", "Override" or go back
Select radio button for existing player and Click Add Report button
From the report page, click Save
custom_expected:
Preliminary report is saved for an existing player
Report appears on the scouts clipboard

title: Scout can save a preliminary report for a preliminary player
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
FIll in fields in create new widget for a new amateur player
CLick Next
Fill in eligible year, and any fields, click SAVE
custom_steps:
[Logged in as the same scout]
Go back to home dashboard
In the create new widget, switch dropdown to Amateur Player Reports 
Enter the players name you just saved in the pre steps, choose Prospect Report
Click Next
Fill in any fields and click Save
custom_expected: Scout is able to successfully save a preliminary report for a preliminary status player

title: Scout cannot submit a player report until player profile is submitted
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout 
2) Scroll down to view “Scout Clipboard”
3) Click on a preliminary report to submit
4) In report, click "Submit" at the bottom-right, followed by “YES.”
custom_expected:
Error message: “This player must be submitted before submitting this player report.”

Note: The scout user cannot submit a player report until player profile is submitted.

title: Scout cannot submit an amateur team report until amateur team is submitted
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Locate Create New Widget and switch dropdown filter to "Amateur Team"
Fill in all fields, and click Next
Fill in all fields on the team profile and click SAVE
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Locate the create new widget
Switch dropdown on create new to Amateur Team Report
Enter the team you just saved in step above and click Next
Fill in all required fields and click submit
custom_expected: Following error message should appear: “This Amateur Team must be submitted before submitting this Amateur Team Report”

title: Scout cannot submit a player until his school is submitted
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout 
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Player,” which is next to “Create New”
3) Fill out required fields (with a school that is not submitted) and click “Next”
custom_expected:
Error message: “The entered School does not exist in eBIS. Please enter an existing School.”

Note:Per the business rules, players may not be approved until the school(s) in their profile is approved.

title: Scout can save and submit a change report
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Player Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” field and select “Change” in “Report Type” field. Then, click "Next."
custom_expected:
The user has the option to “submit” or “save” the report at the bottom-right of the screen.

Save Report:

Pop-up stating: “Amateur Player Report has been successfully saved.” The change report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Preliminary.” Reports with a status of "Preliminary" can be edited by the creating scout and MLSB Admins.

Submit Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Amateur Player Report has been successfully submitted.” The change report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Submitted.”  Reports with a status of "Submitted," are available to all MLSB users by “Quick Search.” It is available to BOC users/admins via Advanced Search.

title: Scout can save and submit an update report
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Player Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” field and select “Update” in “Report Type” field. Then, click "Next."
custom_expected:
The user has the option to “submit” or “save” the report at the bottom-right of the screen.

Save Report:

Pop-up stating: “Amateur Player Report has been successfully saved.” The update report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Preliminary.” Reports with a status of "Preliminary" can be edited by the creating scout and MLSB Admins.

Submit Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Amateur Player Report has been successfully submitted.” The update report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Submitted.”  Reports with a status of "Submitted," are available to all MLSB users by “Quick Search.” It is available to BOC users/admins via Advanced Search.

title: scout can save and submit a vision report
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Vision Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” and Click “Next”
custom_expected:
The user has the option to “submit” or “save” the report at the bottom-right of the screen.

Save Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Vision Report has been successfully saved.” The Vision Report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Preliminary.” Reports with a status of "Preliminary" can be edited by the creating scout and MLSB Admins.

Submit Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Vision Report has been successfully submitted.” The Vision Report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Submitted.”  Reports with a status of "Submitted," are available to all MLSB users by “Quick Search.” It is available to BOC users/admins via Advanced Search.

title: scout can save and submit a signability report
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Signability Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” and Click “Next”
custom_expected:
The user has the option to “submit” or “save” the report at the bottom-right of the screen.

Save Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Signability Report has been successfully saved.” The Signability Report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Preliminary.” Reports with a status of "Preliminary" can be edited by the creating scout and MLSB Admins.

Submit Report:

Pop-up stating: “The Signability Report has been successfully submitted.” The Signability Report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Submitted.”  Reports with a status of "Submitted," are available to all MLSB users by “Quick Search.” It is available to BOC users/admins via Advanced Search.

title: scout submitted reports appear on the scouts clipboard and admin clipboard
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Signability Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” and Click “Next”
4) Fill out required fields and click “submit”
custom_expected:
Pop-up stating the report has been successfully submitted. 
The report will instantly appear in the “Scout Clipboard,” with a status of “Submitted.” 
It will also appear in the clipboard of an admin account.

title: Admin can approve multiple reports at once from clipboard
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Scroll down to view “Admin Clipboard”
3) User should then highlight the reports that they would like to approve
4) Click “Approve” at the bottom-right of the clipboard
5) A screen will appear saying: “Are you sure you want to approve the selected items?” Click “Yes”
custom_expected: Pop-up “Approval Success,” will appear stating that the players have been approved.

title: Scout can submit a prospect report for a pitcher
custom_steps:
Login as a scout and locate the create new widget
Choose "Amateur Player Report" From the create new dropdown
In the Name textbox, enter 3 letters for a players name who is already in the system (i.e. Jac for Jackson, Alex)
Choose a Player who is NOT a pitcher and select "Report Type" [Prospect]
Click next
On the report page, change the players position to a PITCHER position
Fill in required fields and click Submit
custom_expected:
-On switching players position to a PITCHER, additional fields will appear in the "Player Evaluation' section
-Player report is submitted and shows as submitted on the clipboard

title: Scout can submit a 'prospect' report for position player
custom_steps:
Login as a scout and locate the create new widget
Choose "Amateur Player Report" From the create new dropdown
In the Name textbox, enter 3 letters for a players name who is already in the system (i.e. Jac for Jackson, Alex)
Choose a Player who IS a pitcher and select "Report Type" [Prospect]
Click next
On the report page, change the players position to a FIELDER position
Fill in required fields and click Submit
Expected Result
custom_expected:
-On switching players position to a FIELDER, additional fields will disappear in the "Player Evaluation' section
-Player report is submitted and shows as submitted on the clipboard

title: Scout can submit a preliminary item from the clipboard
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Scroll down to view “Scout Clipboard”
3) User should then highlight the preliminary report(s) that they would like to submit
4) Click “Submit” at the bottom-right of the clipboard (All required fields of a preliminary item must be entered to proceed)
5) A screen will appear saying: “Are you sure you want to approve the selected items?” Click “Yes.”
custom_expected: Pop-up stating the report has been successfully saved and submitted.

title: scout can delete a preliminary item from the clipboard
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout 
2) Scroll down to view “Scout Clipboard”
3) User should then highlight the preliminary report(s) that they would like to delete
4) Click “Delete” at the bottom-right of the clipboard
5) A screen will appear reminding the user that the selected item will be deleted. Click “Yes”
custom_expected: Pop-up stating the report has been successfully deleted.

title: Scout can only print reports after they have been approved
custom_preconds:
Login as admin
CLick on a report from the admin clipboard with a status of Submitted
Scroll to the bottom and click Approve button
(Note player whose report who you are approving)
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Search for player noted above in quicksearch and open his profile
CLick on Scouting and Drafts Tab
Click on the Report you just approved
Click Print
custom_expected:
Report is printed in PDF Version
*Note that submitted reports will not have a print button

title: Scout cannot edit reports once theyve been submitted
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Scroll down to view “Scout Clipboard”
3) Click on report with a status of “Submitted”
4) View the available buttons at the bottom of the profile screen
custom_expected:
The “Edit” button should not be available on a report that has a status of “Submitted.”

Scouts can only edit reports that have a status of “Preliminary.”

title: Scout can make updates to an approved school
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
From quicksearch bar, click the downward arrow and choose "schools" from radiobutton option
Enter in any 4 letters to start populating school results (i.e. West)
Click on any school from the list of results to open profile
ENsure that the status is "Approved"
Click Edit button and make changes to any fields and click Save button
custom_expected:
Scout is able to edit and save new changes to the profile
Blue success notification appears

title: "Present" value in any OFP category must be less than or equal to the "Future" value
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Click “Amateur Player Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Enter Name and Report Type and click “Next”
4) Fill out required fields
5) Enter a “Present Value” (P) which greater than a “Future” (F) value
6) Click “Submit”
7) A pop-up will appear asking if the user is sure they would like to submit. Click “Yes”
custom_expected: The user will receive an error message that states that “future values must be greater than or equal to present values.”

title: OFP categories must have a value of 0 or 2-8
custom_steps:
Login as scout
On the create new widget, choose Amateur Report
Enter in a name on the name field, and choose prospect report
Click next
Scroll down to the "Player Exaluation" section of the report
Enter in a number that is not 0, or between 2-8 (i.e. Enter 9) in one of the boxes for labeled "hitting ability, power, etc" for Present or Future value
Clcik Tab or Enter
custom_expected:
The user will receive a blocker error message that reads: “You have entered an invalid value. Please enter a value of 0 or 2 - 8.”
Only button available is OK
On clicking OK, the error is highlighted in red

title: Maximum velocity must be greater than or equal to minimum velocity.
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Player Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Enter a name for the player field and choose prospect report (change players position to pitcher if needed)
4) Enter a maximum velocity that is less than or equal to minimum velocity
5) Click “Submit”
custom_expected: The user will receive an error message that reads: “Maximum velocity must be greater than or equal to minimum velocity."

title: OFP adjusted cannot be more than 10 pts from OFP Basic
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amatuer Player Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Edit “Name” and Click “Next”
4) Fill out required fields, while editing “OFP Adjusted” field to be 10+ points higher than “OFP Basic” field
5) Click “submit”
6) A pop-up will appear asking if the user is sure they would like to proceed. Click “Yes”
custom_expected: The user will receive an error message that reads: “The following fields contain invalid data: OFP Adjusted - Adjusted OFP can only differ from Basic OFP by 10 or less points.”

title: Scout is able to fill in ALL fields on a report and save
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Locate create new widget and choose Amateur Player Report
Fill in name, and choose 'prospect report'
Fill in ALL fields on the form (not just required fields)
Be sure to fill in 'camp/tournament/league' section, summer club information, next years school, and all fields under "Summary" section
Click Submit
custom_expected:
Report is successfully submitted
All entered information stays on the report
When viewing the report as a scout admin, all entered information is there

title: Scout can submit new player and new report at once
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Fill in create new widget fields for a new amateur player, click Next
Fill in all required fields and click SAVE

Go back to home dashboard, and locate create new widget
Choose Prospect Report, and enter name of the player you just submitted
Fill in all required fields, and click SAVE to save a report for the player
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Go back to home dashboard and view the scout clipboard
Find the player and report you just SAVED in the pre steps
Check off the checkboxes to the left of both items and click SUBMIT button
custom_expected:
Both items are submitted successfully
Confirmation message of successful submission appears

title: Admin can approve new player and report at once
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Fill in create new widget fields for a new amateur player, click Next
Fill in all required fields and click Submit

Go back to home dashboard, and locate create new widget
Choose Prospect Report, and enter name of the player you just submitted
Fill in all required fields, and click Submit to submit a report for the player
custom_steps:
Login as admin
View the admin clipboard
Find the player AND the player report you just submitted in pre-steps
Check the boxes to the left of both and click Approve button
custom_expected:
System Successfully approves of both items
Confirmation message pops up of success

title: Scout can add rows to video log sheet and add new players
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2)Locate the video log sheet widget
3) Click “ADD ROW” 
4) Add in a player who is not in the system (Enter Last Name, First Name)
5) Fill in all other fields
6) Click Save and Print
custom_expected:
System adds additional rows to the Video Log Sheet.
Your new player is added successfully and saved
System allows you to print or export to excel with new player

title: Scout can add existing players to video log sheet and save
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Locate video log sheet widget
3) Click “ADD ROW” 
4) Enter beginning letters of player’s last name into name field to then select player from drop-down
5) Add rows for the same player as well as a row for an additional player
6) Click “SAVE”
custom_expected:
Pop-up stating the Video Log Sheet saved successfully.
Ensure you can print and export the sheet to excel with your new player

title: Scout can export the video log sheet to PDF/Excel
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Locate video log sheet widget
3) Click “ADD ROW” 
4) Enter beginning letters of player’s last name into name field to then select player from drop-down
5) Click “SAVE”
6) Click “PRINT” to download/open a PDF document with the data
7) Click “EXCEL” to download/open an excel document with the data
custom_expected:
Scout can export the video log sheet to a PDF document by clicking “PRINT.”

Scout can export the video log sheet to an Excel document by clicking “EXCEL.”

title: Scout can delete current sheet and create new one
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Locate video log sheet widget
3) Click “ADD ROW” 
4) Enter beginning letters of player’s last name into name field to then select player from drop-down
5) Click “NEW SHEET” at the bottom-right. A pop-up will appear stating: “Completing this Video Log will remove all previously entered players. Are you sure you want to continue?” Click, “YES.”
custom_expected:
A new sheet will be created to enter video logs. 

Note: If the log sheet is not saved prior to hitting “NEW SHEET,” it will be deleted.  If it is saved, the log date can be seen within the player’s profile.

title: Scout can export scouting clipboard to Excel/PDF
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout 
2) Scroll down to view “Scout Clipboard”
3) Click on the utilities and settings icon on the top-right of the Scout Clipboard. A drop down menu will appear.
4) Click “Export to Excel” to export the scout clipboard to an excel document
5) Click “Export to PDF” to export the scout clipboard to a PDF document
custom_expected:
Scout can export the scouting clipboard to an excel document by clicking “Export to Excel.” The document will then download and be available for viewing.

Scout can export the scouting clipboard to a PDF document by clicking “Export to PDF.” The document will then download and be available for viewing.

title: Scout/Admin can sort through columns in any widget, apply filters
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Scroll to any table-based widget
3) Click the Filters Icon
4) Type a filter parameter in the “Type to Filter” text box. 
5) Click “-Select Colum to Filter-” and any additional boxes that appear
custom_expected:
The filter icon allows the user to sort through columns and/or apply filters.

The “Type to Filter” text box is automatically applied when the user stops typing. Below that, the user can select a column to filter.

title: Scout / Admin can perform basic searches
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) View the quick search text box at the top-right of the page
3) Click the down arrow icon in the Quick Search text box and select the radio button for the
desired search type.
4) Type the search parameter in the text box.
custom_expected: Search matches populate as a drop-down after at least three characters have been entered.

title: Scout can delete rows off video log sheet widget
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout 
2) Click “Video Log/Reporting” at the top-right
3) Click “ADD ROW” 
4) Click the trash icon that is visible at the end of any added row
custom_expected: The row will disappear and be deleted.

title: Adding a Video Log Taped Date displays in players profile
custom_preconds: If the video log sheet widget is not on the home dashboard, add it from "Manage Dashboard" link
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
Locate the video log sheet widget
Select "Add row" to enter a new video log
Enter an existing player in the system
The player's info should automatically populate
Scroll over to "Taped Date" and add any past date
Click "save"
Click the "refresh" button on top of the widget to ensure changes have been saved.

Navigate to the same player's profile
Navigate to the "Tracking Information" section on the Info tab
custom_expected: On logging in as scout admin, and viewing the profile for the player above - Admins should be able to view "Filmed Dates" under Tracking Information as the "taped date"

title: Saving Players in Video Log should not cause rows to re-order
custom_steps:
Login as an admin
Locate the video log sheet widget
Click Add Row and Enter 5-10 players in the video log sheet
Fill in all fields for the players (i.e. school, taped, date, DOB, etc)
Enter letters in the comments section in alphabetical order (i.e. A-E)
Click Save
custom_expected: All players should be saved and stay in the order they were entered (Note that the comments section stays in alphabetical order [Not reliant on name, the comment section should remain the same as entered])

title: Scout/Admin can perform advanced searches to search for players, reports, teams
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Click “Search” in the main menu on the right to display advanced search page
3) Click the “SEARCH FOR” drop-down list and select the type of search, such as “Domestic Amateur Player”
4) Edit “Add New Filter” boxes and click “Search”
custom_expected: Search results populate below.

title: Admin can approve a report from the report page
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a submitted report via clipboard or quick search
3) At the bottom of the report, click the blue “Approve” button
custom_expected: Confirmation popup that report was saved and approved

title: Admin can approve a player profile
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a submitted player profile via clipboard or quick search
3) At the bottom of the report, click the blue “Approve” button
custom_expected:
Blue success notification shows that profile approval was successful
Player Profile now has a status of Approved

title: Admin can approve a player/school/team update
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin 
2) Scroll down to view “Admin Clipboard”
3) User should then highlight items with types that read, “Player Updated," "School Updated," and "Team Updated.”
4) Click “Approve”
5) A message will appear asking if the user is sure they want to approve the selected items. Click “YES”
custom_expected: “Approval Success” pop-up will appear with a list of approved reports

title: Admin can create a new scout
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) In the Create New widget, scroll down and select the drop down option "Scout"
3) Fill out required fields, ensure the "active" box is checked off and click Save button
custom_expected:
Confirmation popup that scout was saved
New Scout shows up in the scout directory widget

title: Admin can add a player to the Top 200 Widget
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a submitted player profile via clipboard or quick search (Player must have Eligible Year = to the Upcoming Draft Year.)
3) Click “Edit” at the bottom-right of the profile
4) Check off “Top 200” checkbox at the top-left
5) Click “Approve” at the bottom-right
custom_expected:
Confirmation popup that player profile was saved.
View the Top 200 Widget and ensure player appears there.

title: Admin can make changes to profile at any point
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a approved player
3) Click “Edit” at the bottom-right of the profile
4) Edit any 2-3 fields
5) Click “Save” at the bottom-right
custom_expected:
Confirmation popup that profile edit was saved.

For admins, updating a player's profile does not need approval.

title: Admin Rejected items open in edit mode when sent back to creating scout
custom_preconds:
Login as scout [i.e. Dan Dixon]
Submit a new player or report
custom_steps:
Sign on as a scout admin
View the clipboard and find the submitted player or report in pre-steps
Click the checkbox to the left and click REJECT button
Click YES on the confirmation message
custom_expected:
You will get a confirmation that the item has been rejected
Once signed on as the submitting scout [i.e. Dan DIxon], this item will appear on your clipboard with a status of rejected
WHen clicking on this item from the clipboard, it will open in edit mode ready for submission

title: Admin can print reports at any point
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a submitted report via clipboard or quick search
3) Click “Print” at the bottom-right of the report
custom_expected: PDF file will download/open with ability to view and print the report

title: Top 200 checkbox is only available for player with an eligible year of upcoming draft
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Open a submitted player profile via clipboard or quick search – Choose a player that has an eligible draft year other than the upcoming one
3) Click “Edit” at the bottom-right of the profile
4) Attempt to check off “Top 200” checkbox at the top-left
custom_expected:
The user should not be able to check off the “Top 200” checkbox.

The "Top 200" checkbox is only available for players with an Eligible Year = to the Upcoming Draft Year.

title: All items open in edit mode for the admin regardless of status
custom_steps:
Login as admin-mlsb-1
Navigate to the Scouting Admin Clipboard widget
Select and open any item from the clipboard
custom_expected: All items open in edit mode no matter its current status

title: Admin can print a newly approved report
custom_steps:
Login as admin-mlsb-1
Navigate to Scouting Admin Clipboard
Select a report that has been submitted and approve it
Open the newly approved report
At the bottom, select print
custom_expected: The approved report should download in a PDF file ready for printing

title: Admin can remove any item from the clipboard
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
View the scout admin clipboard
Find a submitted item on the clipboard
Check the checkbox to the left of the item and click "remove" button
Click Yes on the confirmation message
custom_expected:
Item is 'removed from the clipboard' 
Item is not hard deleted and can still be found by advanced search

title: Scout can create a new school and submit
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Click “School,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Enter required fields and click “Next”
4) Fill out required fields and click “Submit”
5) A pop-up will appear asking if the user is sure they would like to proceed. Click “Yes”
custom_expected:
School is successfully submitted
School appears on the scouts clipboard as 'submitted'

title: Scout cannot submit a school team report until school is submitted
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Locate Create New Widget and switch dropdown filter to "School"
Fill in all fields, and click Next
Fill in all fields on the school profile and click SAVE
Steps
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Locate the create new widget
Switch dropdown on create new to School team report Report

Enter the school you just saved in step above and click Next
Fill in all required fields and click submit
custom_expected: Following error message should appear: “This school must be submitted before submitting this School Team Report”

title: Scout Admin Approves New School
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Locate create new widget and choose "school"
Fill in fields in create new widget, click Next
Fill in required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as scout ADMIN
View the scout admin clipboard, filter by "school entered"
Find the submitted school from pre steps
Click on the 'school entered' link to open the profile
Check off the "Active" Checkbox
Click Approve button
custom_expected:
School profile is successfully approved and marked active
School will now appear in quicksearch

title: Scout Admin rejects a new school
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Locate create new widget and choose "school"
Fill in fields in create new widget, click Next
Fill in required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as scout ADMIN
View the scout admin clipboard, filter by "school entered"
Find the submitted school from pre steps
Check off the checkbox to the left of the school
Click reject Button
Click Yes on the confirmation message
custom_expected: school is successfully rejected and disappears from the admins clipboard

title: System finds a possible match to an existing school
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Find quicksearch bar, use the downward arrow to change radio button to "schools"
Enter in any 4 common letters to find an existing school (i.e. West)
From the search results, click on any school name
Ensure that the school profile has a status of "Approved"
Note down the name of the school, the type of school (HS, 4YR), the city and state of the school
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Go back to home dashboard
Locate the create new widget
Choose "School" from create new dropdown
Enter in the same information as the school noted in pre steps (same name, type, city and state)
Click Next
custom_expected:
A warning message should pop up that the school entered matches 100% to an existing school
Only button available is BACK

title: Scout submits an update to an approved school
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
In the quicksearch bar, click the arrow and change the radio button to "schools"
Enter in any common 4 letters to find a selection of schools ( i.e. "West")
Select a schoolfrom the search results to open the profile
Ensure that the status is "Approved"
Click Edit and edit any fields
Cick Submit
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
View the scout admin clipboard and filter to "school updated"
Find the school you updated in pre steps and click on "school updated" link from the clipboard
View the updates
custom_expected:
The changes the scout made will appear in red for the admin
Admin from this point is able to approve, reject the updates

title: Admin can approve updates to school profile
custom_preconds: The previous test case must be run in order to successfully run this test case.
custom_steps:
Login as an admin
Filter the clipboard to find ' school updated'
Find the school you updated previously and click on 'school updated' link to open the updates
Click Approve
custom_expected: Changes made are approved successfully

title: Only Admins and BOC can mark schools Active/Inactive
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Navigate quicksearch bar and click downward arrow
Change radio button to "schools"
Enter any 4 common letters to find a selection of schools (i.e. West)
Select a school from search results to open school profile
Click Edit
Look for "Active" checkbox and try to check it off
custom_expected: This checkbox should be greyed out and disabled. A scout cannot mark a school active or inactive

title: Scout cannot submit a player profile that contains a School that has not yet been submitted ( Duplicate of C52506 )
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Locate create new widget and select school from dropdown
Enter fields in create new, click Next
Fill in any fields and click SAVE
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Go back to home, and locate create new
Choose Amateur Player in the create new dropdown
Enter fields for player, for school field, choose school saved in pre steps

Fill in all required fields and click Submit
custom_expected: Error message should pop up to say the player cannot be submitted until his school is submitted

title: A report with a status of "Submitted" or "Approved" cannot be edited by any Scout
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Click on Search on left Nav
Use advanced search filters to find Amateur Player Report > Status is > Approved
Click on any report to open it
custom_expected:
There is no editing allowed
The only buttons should be print and close

title: Player report cannot be approved until player has been approved ( Duplicate )
Scout submits a new amateur team
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Click “Amateur Team,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Enter required fields and click “Next”
4) Review fields and click “Submit”
5) A pop-up will appear asking if the user is sure they would like to submit the Amateur Team. Click “Yes”
custom_expected: Confirmation popup that team was saved and submitted.

title: Scout submits a new team report
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Team Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Input an amateur team in the required field. After putting three letters into the field, an option list should drop down, and the user can select a team based on the three letters entered. Click “Next”
4) Enter required fields and click “Submit.” A message will appear asking if the user is sure they want to submit the Amateur Team Report. Click “YES”
custom_expected: Pop-up stating that the Amateur Team Report has been saved and submitted.

title: Scout submits a team profile update
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
In the quicksearch bar, click the arrow and change the radio button to "teams"
Enter in any common 4 letters to find a selection of teams ( i.e. "West")
Select a team from the search results to open the profile
Ensure that the status is "Approved"
Click Edit and edit any fields
Cick Submit
custom_steps:
Login as a scout admin
View the scout admin clipboard and filter to "team updated"
Find the team you updated in pre steps and click on "team updated" link from the clipboard
View the updates
custom_expected:
The changes the scout made will appear in red for the admin
Admin from this point is able to approve, reject the updates

title: Scout Admin Approves an Amateur Team
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic scout
Choose Amateur team from the create new widget dropdown
Enter fields on the create new widget, click Next
Enter required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as scout admin
View the admin clipboard and filter to "team entered"
Locate the team entered from pre steps
Check off the checkbox the left and click Approve
custom_expected: Success notification of team approval shows

title: System finds a possible match to an existing team profile
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Find quicksearch bar, use the downward arrow to change radio button to "teams"
Enter in any 4 common letters to find an existing team (i.e. West)
From the search results, click on any team name
Ensure that the team profile has a status of "Approved"
Note down the name of the team, the group type, the team type, and city and state of the team
custom_steps:
[Logged in as same scout]
Go back to home dashboard
Locate the create new widget and choose "Amateur team" from the dropdown
Enter in the same *exact* information as the team noted in pre steps 
Click Next
custom_expected:
A warning message should pop up that the school entered matches 100% to an existing school
Only button available is BACK

title: Scout adds new players to team report and clicks save
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) On the homepage, click “Amateur Team Report,” in the drop down menu which is next to “Create New”
3) Input an amateur team in the required field. After putting three letters into the field, an option list should drop down, and the user can select a team based on the three letters entered. Click “Next”
4) In the Team Report section, fill in the required “Dates Seen” field
5) To add a player into the “Position Player Roster” or the “Pitcher Roster,” type in three letters in the “Name” field. This will bring about name options that will appear that you can select. Complete the fields that did not auto-populate including the comments section. You can also add a row and complete this step again.
6) Click “Save”
custom_expected:
Pop-up stating that the Amateur Team Report has been saved. 

Amateur Team Report will be available in the Scout Clipboard, with players entered having "preliminary status".

title: Scout deletes players off the team report and saves
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open an Amateur Team Report via clipboard or quick search (preliminary or rejected)
3) Click on the trash icon at the far-right side of the player you wish to delete
4) A message titled “Confirm delete” will appear asking if the user is sure they would like to remove the row. Click “Yes”
5) Click save to confirm player removal
custom_expected: Player will be removed from the report, and edit will be saved. Pop-up confirmation that edits are saved.

title: Scout can make updates to an approved amateur team profile (Duplicate)
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open an approved Amateur Team profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click “Edit” at the bottom-right to make updates
4) Make changes to 1-2 fields
5) Click “Submit”
custom_expected: Pop-up confirming updates are submitted.

title: Admin can approve/ reject updates to amateur team profile
custom_preconds: The previous test case must be run in order to successfully run this test case.
custom_steps:
1) Login as an admin
2) Click the desired "Amateur Team Updated Report" in the “Admin Clipboard” to open
3) The update(s) made by the scout will appear in red
4) Click on the blue “Approve” button to approve the update or “Reject” to reject it
custom_expected:
Clicking “Approve”: pop-up stating that the amateur team has been successfully saved and approved.

Clicking “Reject”: pop-up stating that the amateur team has been successfully saved and rejected.

title: Amateur Team Report cannot be approved until amateur team is approved
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Submit an amateur team(team must be in submitted state, NOT preliminary, NOT approved)
custom_steps:
Login as a scout
Create a team report for the team report submitted in step above
Click Submit

Login as an admin
Find the submitted team REPORT
Click Approve
custom_expected:
The user should receive the following error message: “This amateur team must be approved before approving this amateur team report

*If approving both the TEAM and the REPORT at once from the clipboard, the system should allow this*

title: A profile must exist for a team in order for a team report to be created for that team
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Locate create new widget and choose Amateur Team Report in the dropdown
3) Enter an Amateur Team that does not exist in the system ( i.e. ABC Team)
4) Click Next
custom_expected: Error message: “The entered Amateur Team does not exist in eBIS. Please enter an existing Amateur Team.”

title: Players required fields should change based on their prospect status
custom_preconds: Given that the user is logged into scout
custom_steps:
1. Go to create new widget
2. Click dropdown in Create new widget
3. Change to Amateur Team Report
4. Type in 3 letters in the Amateur Team Box ( Using Consonant, Vowel, Consonant usually works )
5. Select a team from dropdown
6. Select next
7. Go to Position Player Roster
8. Type in a name
9. Change Prospect field to any field
10. Click submit
custom_expected:
1. Create new widget has Domestic Amateur Player as default dropdown with text boxes.
2. Dropdown has selection of create new options for scout
3. Create new is changed to Amateur Team Report option
4. Schools with those 3 letters will appear in a dropdown
5. Team is selected and inputted into text box
6. Amateur team report appears on screen with Team Report, Team info, Position Player Roster, and Pitcher Roster
7. Position players roster appears with Pos,Age,Ht,Wt,B/T,Prospect,Class,Hit,Pwr,Run,Arm,and Fld.
8. Name dropdown should appear, do not select one
9. Prospect is changed to another field
10. Errors should pop up corresponding to the Prospect chosen and the required fields associated with the chosen prospect.

title: Scout can save a new school schedule
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open a school profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click on the “Schedule” tab
4) Click “Create New”
5) Select “Year” and “Season” and click “Create”
6) Click “Add Row” and populate required fields
7) Click “Save”
custom_expected: Pop-up stating that the schedule has been successfully saved.

title: Scout can submit a new school schedule
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open a school profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click on the “Schedule” tab
4) Click “Create New”
5) Select “Year” and “Season” and click “Create”
6) Click “Add Row” and populate required fields
7) Click “Submit” - A message will pop-up asking if the user is sure they would like to submit the school schedule. Click “Yes”
custom_expected: Pop-up stating that the schedule has been successfully saved and submitted.

title: Scout can add/delete rows off a school schedule
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open a school profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click on the “Schedule” tab
4) Click “Create New”
5) Select “Year” and “Season” and click “Create”
6) Click “Add Row” (User can also select “Add 5 Rows” or “Add 10 Rows”)
7) To Delete any selected row, click on the trash icon at the far-right of the row
custom_expected:
Upon clicking “Add Row,” a row will be added to the school schedule.

Clicking the trash can icon will successfully delete a row from the school schedule.

title: Scout can delete a school schedule
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open a school profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click on the “Schedule” tab
4) Click "Create New"
5) Select “Year” and “Season” -> Schedule will appear
6) Click "Add Row" to enter a game, then click "Save"
7) Click “Delete” button
custom_expected:
Upon clicking “Delete,” the user should be able to remove the schedule. 

Note: Only saved schedules can be deleted. Once a schedule is submitted, the creating scout can no longer edit or delete the schedule.

title: Scout can print a school schedule
custom_steps:
1) Login as a scout
2) Open a school profile via clipboard or quick search
3) Click on the “Schedule” tab
4) Select “Year” and “Season” -> Schedule will appear
5) Click “Print” button at the bottom-right
custom_expected: Upon clicking “Print,” a printable PDF file will download, in which the user can open and print.

title: Clubs are allowed to see schedules once approved by an Admin
custom_preconds: User must already have created a submitted school schedule and approve it using admin account
custom_steps:
1) Login as a club
2) Open desired school profile via quick search
3) Click the “Schedule” tab at the top-right
custom_expected: User now able view the approved schedules for that school.

title: Scout cannot edit approved schedules
custom_steps:
Login as a domestic scout
Navigate to Advanced Search
Search for "Schedules"
Add filter: "Record status" "is" "approved"
Search
Open a school schedule from the results
custom_expected: Scout should not be able to edit the schedule

title: Admins can approve schedules and changes are auto approved
custom_steps:
Login as scout admin
Navigate to Scouting Admin Clipboard widget
Filter to the widget to display Schedules
1. Open a schedule from the widget and approve it from the schedule's page
(Note: also make sure to check that admin can approve the schedule right from the roster widget)
Select edit, and make changes to the schedule
2. Save
custom_expected:
1. Schedule is successfully approved
2. Changes to the schedule are successfully saved and automatically approved

title: Only ONE schedule may be created for the same year and season for a school
custom_steps:
Login as scout admin
Navigate to a school's profile via QuickSearch or Advanced Search
Select the Schedule tab
Select "Create New" and fill in a year and season that the School already has a schedule for
Select Create
custom_expected: Blocker error with message "Please choose a year and season that do not already exist" and only an OK button.

title: Games on a schedule should be ordered by date and time in ascending order on Save and Submit
custom_steps:
Login as scout admin
Navigate to a school's profile via Quick Search or Advanced Search
Select the Schedule tab
On an existing schedule, select edit
In edit mode, add rows to add games to the schedule
Add games with different dates and times
Save
custom_expected: The games should save and be re-ordered so that their dates and times are in ascending order

title: Preliminary Items are only available by quicksearch for submitting scout
custom_preconds:

Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next
Fill in any fields, and Click save button

Type in the players last name in quicksearch

Peform search Players Last Name > Equals > [Last Name of Player from pre steps]

title: Preliminary items do not appear as a match for anyone but the submitting scout(MARKED FOR REMOVAL, DO NOT TEST)
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic Scout
Locate the create new widget
Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next
Fill in any fields, and Click save button

[Logged in as same scout]

Fill in same information for player as above
CLick Next

Repeat with a CLub/BOC Login

title: Submitted Items are available to all MLSB users through quicksearch

Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next

Peform advanced search for player noted above

Login as MLSB Admin
Repeat steps
custom_expected: Submitted Player profile should be available by quicksearch and Advanced Search for other scouts and MLSB Admins

title: Submitted Items are available to BOC only by Advanced Search
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic Scout
Locate the create new widget
Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next
Fill in all required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:

CLick on Advanced Search on Left Nav
Peform Search for Players Last Name > Equals > [Last Name from above step]
Click Search

Player profile should NOT display in quicksearch

title: Submitted Items should appears as a match for ALL MLSB users
custom_preconds:
Login as a domestic Scout
Locate the create new widget
Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next
Fill in all required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as MLSB Admin
Locate Create New Widget
Fill in the same info for player as above
Click Next

title: Submitted Items should NOT appear as a match for Club/BOC Users

Locate the create new widget
Fill in all fields on create new widget and click Next
Fill in all required fields, click Submit

Login as BOC
Enter the same information as player above
Click Next

custom_expected: No Matching message should pop up for either BOC or CLub user

title: Approved Items are visible to all users (MLSB,CLub,BOC)
custom_preconds:
Login as a scout
Use quicksearch or advanced search to find a player who has a profile status of "Approved"
Note his information
custom_steps:
Login as BOC User
Click Search on Left Nav
Search for Domestic Amateur Player > Last Name is > [Last Name of Player from pre=steps]
Click Search
Locate player and click on name to open profile

Repeat all steps as above to advance search the player

title: Rejected Items are only available by quicksearch by submitting scout

Login as a scout (i.e. Dan Dixon)
Submit a new player profile

Login as scout admin
Find the submitted player profile from above and open profile
Scroll down and click Reject
custom_steps:
Login as same scout as above (i.e. Dan Dixon)
Enter the rejected players last name in quicksearch
custom_expected: Rejected player should be availavle by quicksearch

title: Rejected Items are only available by advanced search for BOC/Scout Admins
custom_preconds:
*Can use the same player as previous test case OR

Login as a scout (i.e. Dan Dixon)
Submit a new player profile


Login as scout admin
Find the submitted player profile from above and open profile
Scroll down and click Reject

Peform Advanced search to find player rejected above

Perform advanced search to find player above
custom_expected: Player is available by advanced search for BOC and Scout Admin users

title: Rejected Items should not appear as a possible match for anyone except the creating scout
custom_preconds:
*Can use the same player as previous test case OR

Login as a scout (i.e. Dan Dixon)
Submit a new player profile

Login as scout admin
Find the submitted player profile from above and open profile
Scroll down and click Reject

Click Next

Enter the same info of the rejected player as above
Click Next
custom_expected:
Scout should get a matching message that the player he's attempting to submit matches to an existing player

Club should NOT get a matching message for this player

title: Scout 1 can use a Scout 2 submitted player to submit a report
custom_preconds:
Login as scout 1 [ie. Dan Dixon]
Fill in the create new widget for a new amateur player
Click Next
Fill in all required fields, click Submit
custom_steps:
Login as scout 2 [ i.e. Walt Burrows]
Choose Amateur Player Report > Prospect Report in the create new widget
Enter the name of the player submitted as [scout 1]
Click Next
Fill in all required fields and click Submit
custom_expected: Scout 2 can successfully submit a report for a player that was submitted by scout 1 (no admin approval needed here)
